examples: We may be going through a rough patch in our relationship, but in the end things will mend - as long as we communicate openly and honestly, we can work through our issues.
But a Medwell representative openly promoted its robust export business in an interview on state TV.
Official people, deputy prime ministers are talking about corruption openly at investment forums to Western bankers.
The United States deals openly, fairly.
Walking around openly with a Hammerskins jacket.
words.defineEn: in a way that is honest or direct
words.defineVi: một cách trung thực hoặc trực tiếp

examples: The public disclosure of the Tuskegee study led to an increase in mistrust of the Public Health Service and, more broadly, the American medical community.
Steel was important to our national security broadly.
On Wall Street, stocks were broadly higher.
The protest sentiments were shared rather broadly by up to one-third of the Russian people.
Broadly, it’s any protective layer.
words.defineEn: in general and regardless of minor details
words.defineVi: nói chung và không quan tâm đến tiểu tiết

examples: Discrimination based on race or religion is morally unacceptable and considered bad.
So, morally, I completely agree.
So, morally, I completely agree.
Morally relevant differences are things that would actually justify unequal treatment.
They’re all morally corrupt.
words.defineEn: with regard to what behavior is wrong or right
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hành vi nào là sai hay đúng

examples: It was too near for comfort.
The big fellow keeps a fish shop near the post office.
Some of his jokes are a bit near the knuckle.
I hear the sound of seagulls near the sea.
My grandmother stands near the entrance to greet guests.
words.defineEn: not far in distance
words.defineVi: khoảng cách không xa

examples: That rate nudges upward to 40 to 50 percent.
The barreleye looks upward through its translucent head.
So the thrust was always vertically upward.
And jet fuel prices were trending upward.
And since 2008 the stock has maintained a slow steady climb upward.
words.defineEn: facing or pointing toward a higher level or position
words.defineVi: đối mặt hoặc hướng tới một cấp độ hoặc vị trí cao hơn

examples: Collectively, ants alone make up 20% of the entire animal biomass on land.
some Russian legislators collectively raised a champagne toast.
These proteins are collectively called cryptochromes.
These projects are collectively called Extremely Large Telescopes, or ELTs.
These benefits are collectively known as ecosystem services.
words.defineEn: in a way that involves or refers to a group as a whole
words.defineVi: trong một cách mà liên quan đến hoặc đề cập đến một nhóm như một toàn thể

examples: We don't come away from all this with wildly genial feelings towards the author. .
Out the gate, the company's latest video game console has proven wildly popular.
Eventually, the whole thing cascades wildly.
Milk prices can fluctuate, sometimes wildly.
he cried wildly.
words.defineEn: in a way that is not restrained or controlled
words.defineVi: theo cách không bị hạn chế hoặc kiểm soát

examples: The infrastructure, the electrical infrastructure in Puerto Rico was severely destroyed.
These stabby crystals, and other plant proteins on them, can severely irritate the delicate tissue in a mouth.
And finally, the big one will severely impact the economy.
We severely limit our talent pool in a number of ways.
At the time, Attica prison was severely overcrowded.
words.defineEn: very badly or to a serious extent
words.defineVi: rất tệ hoặc đến một mức độ nghiêm trọng

examples: Its stock price has fallen substantially over the last couple of months.
Oh, they would benefit very substantially.
And they must contribute substantially to military protection from now on.
So it's substantially better at its job in infecting people.
So it's substantially better at its job in infecting people.
words.defineEn: to a considerable extent or degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ đáng kể hoặc mức độ

examples: A federal judge in Texas has temporarily blocked President Biden's 100 day deportation ban.
The plant temporarily halted operations on April 25th.
In September 2016, the news lifted the stock temporarily.
First, a female wasp temporarily paralyzes a cockroach with a quick venomous stab.
Temporarily closing schools and offices.
words.defineEn: in a way that lasts for a limited period of time
words.defineVi: trong một cách mà kéo dài trong một khoảng thời gian giới hạn

examples: She sprinkled dried alkanet petals in her bathwater, turning it into a relaxing and visually appealing soak.
And you see that here visually.
Visually, it’s awesome.
And then we tell that story visually with the furnishings.
Visually, they’re harder to make out.
words.defineEn: in a way that is related to seeing, sight, or appearance
words.defineVi: trong một cách có liên quan đến nhìn thấy, thị giác, hoặc xuất hiện

examples: Trump's maximum pressure campaign failed utterly.
The thumb is utterly unique.
But her schedule was utterly unpredictable.
They are utterly without laws, conscience or respect for human life.
The utterly chaotic scenes in World War Z legitimately give me anxiety.
words.defineEn: (used for emphasis) to the fullest degree or extent
words.defineVi: (được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh) ở mức độ hoặc mức độ đầy đủ nhất

examples: I didn't know that skirret may not be as readily available as more common root vegetables.

As the wall came in, we readily the American side.

The good news is detection is now readily available.
words.defineEn: in a way that is immediate and involves no hesitation or reluctance
words.defineVi: theo cách đó là ngay lập tức và liên quan đến không do dự hoặc miễn cưỡng

examples: He saw his role and his position instinctively.
Koalas, for example, will instinctively crawl up trees, trapping themselves in the flames.
Instinctively, we've become expert nutritionists, hunting out what we need from our food.
When I have a color on the canvas I would know immediately, instinctively, what is the next color that has to be next to it.
- As individuals, we instinctively tighten our purse strings when times are tough and let the wind flow freely when times are good.
words.defineEn: in a way that is done because of natural instinct rather than practice or reflection
words.defineVi: theo cách được thực hiện vì bản năng tự nhiên hơn là thực hành hoặc phản ánh

examples: Her recent conduct is beyond the pale.
His opinions are entirely beyond the pale.
The paintings were damaged beyond recall.
In a criminal trial the standard of proof is beyond the reasonable doubt.
The relationship between the two friends had deteriorated beyond repair.
words.defineEn: to or at the side that is further
words.defineVi: đến hoặc ở bên đó là xa hơn

examples: Ironically, sunspots actually increase the energy output of the Sun.
And ironically, some regard the once revolutionary metric system as a symbol of global conformity.
Ironically, these resonances, these little islands of stability throughout the universe, are a memory of a past full of movement and change.
And some people were, perhaps ironically, better at that defensive thinking.
Ironically, Kodak actually invented the first digital camera back in 1975.
words.defineEn: used for saying that a situation is odd, unexpected, paradoxical, or accidental
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một tình huống là kỳ quặc, bất ngờ, nghịch lý hoặc tình cờ

examples: Airport security was extra tight in the wake of yesterday's bomb attacks.

Jane sure ran a tight ship around here.

He hung tight for 50 minutes, awaiting further instructions.
words.defineEn: in a way that is firm or intense
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là công ty hoặc dữ dội

examples: Lower energy consumption means less pollution.

words.defineEn: close to the ground; in or to a low position
words.defineVi: Gần mặt đất; ở hoặc đến một vị trí thấp

examples: Your presentation sounded great, honestly.

To show great courage.

The baby has brought them great joy.
words.defineEn: extremely well

examples: So only a thinking adult could knowingly participate in Christian faith enough to accept Jesus as lord and savior.

He wouldn't knowingly hurt me, but by one careless word he could destroy, if not my life, at least my chance of happiness.
For millennia Parvati had merely smiled knowingly as Shiva dismissed the things she nurtured.
Finally, wear earplugs when you’re knowingly exposing yourself to loud sounds for extended periods.
words.defineEn: in a deliberate manner or while being aware or conscious about the result of one's action
words.defineVi: một cách có chủ ý hoặc trong khi nhận thức hoặc ý thức về kết quả của hành động của một người

examples: When everyone in the group agreed on the idea without questioning it, John reminded them of the proverb great minds think alike, though fools seldom differ, to encourage them to think independently and critically.

Our ancestors and ant ancestors evolved legs independently.
- Independently, at NASA's Langley Research Center, and alternate approach to lunar simulation was initiated.
Instead, they each acquired that ability independently, at different times.
words.defineEn: without being controlled or influenced by someone or something else
words.defineVi: không bị kiểm soát hoặc ảnh hưởng bởi ai đó hoặc cái gì khác

examples: You can simply do the same thing remotely with cyberweapons.

words.defineEn: with no direct or physical contact; from a distance
words.defineVi: không có tiếp xúc trực tiếp hoặc vật lý; từ xa

examples: But, internally, Hamzah's defenders defied the government.

words.defineEn: in a way that is related to the inside of something
words.defineVi: trong một cách có liên quan đến bên trong của một cái gì đó

examples: Notably, the automaker is expanding its Toyota racing development or TR D sub brand.

words.defineEn: used to introduce the most important part of what is being said
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để giới thiệu phần quan trọng nhất của những gì đang được nói

examples: The business consultant recommended that we expand our operations overseas, but when we faced unexpected challenges and losses, he was not held accountable, highlighting the reality that advisors run no risks.
